results.title: How the first letter was written
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Adapted from Rudyard Kipling’s “Just so stories” this animated film is a mythical story about the world’s first letter written by a cave girl humorously illustrating the advantages of written communication.

results.title: How does it feel?
results.creator_credit: Mick Csaky, Arts Council of Great Britain and Pictures That Move
results.brief_description: Covers various areas of neurophysiology, creativity and bio energetic therapy, with a commentary about getting back in touch with our senses. Gives a number of insights about human nature, twentieth century living conditions and creativity. Based on the book by Frances Hudson.

results.title: House: after five years of living
results.brief_description: The first of a certain thread of films by Charles and Ray Eames that used still images in a very filmic way. The still camera offered a freedom and flexibility that allowed Charles and Ray to capture lyrical images of their house, its garden and its decor and to provide a lasting impression of the house during their life there. The house is a classic of post-war American architecture which the Eameses designed and built in 1949 as part of the Case Study House Program. Music composed by Elmer Bernstein. Performed by Martin Ruderman (flute), Dorothy Remsen (harp), Armand Kaproff (cello) and Elmer Bernstein (piano).

results.title: Hotspot
results.brief_description: Shows the Nyiragongo Volcano in the Republic of Zaire, Africa. The visuals, set against the music of J.S. Bach, fill the screen with spectacular scenes of cracked earth, rivers of dried and molten lava, and gas explosions. Cauldrons of bubbling lava and geyser-like plumes of liquid rock shoot skywards from a smoking landscape.

results.title: Hospital accident prevention: how to survive the working day
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Don Charlton and Consort Films
results.brief_description: A safety film on hospitals. Hospitals are unique in many aspects, and an unusual guided tour highlights the risks, risk areas and their special hazards. Safety procedures are explained and the way to avoid accidents diagnosed. Peter Sallis (portraying the safety officer) and Fred, the cartoon character explore the hospital. Fred finds out for himself that if safety rules are ignored in one deparment, innocent people in another can and do get hurt!
results.title_for_label: Hospital accident prevention: how to survive the working day

results.title: Horses, riders, successes: German equestrianism today
results.brief_description: In Germany a large proportion of the horse population is employed in industry, agriculture, and in breeding, whereas the number of horses used for sport is by comparison small. The chief breeding areas are near Hanover, in Oldenberg, Westphalia, and Schleswig-Holstein. Breeding and sport often combine. Shows the work, training and successes of German horsemen.

results.title: The Hopi Indian
results.brief_description: Presents the way of life of the Hopi in Arizona’s Grand Canyon. Stresses the degree to which these people have adjusted themselves to a difficult environment, showing their irrigation systems and food crops. Describes the secret marriage ritual of the Hopi Indian from the initial baking of corn for bread making to the final wedding ceremony.

results.title: Home care
results.brief_description: Based upon the experience of Montefiore Hospital, New York, this film depicts home care programs as an effective approach toward the treatment of patients with chronic disease, and shows such are of patients with cancer, heart disease, asthma, arthritis and other conditions. Discusses factors considered in the selection of patients for home care and the role of the doctor, nurse and social worker in the treatment.
